premise_source_doc_sentence: In Hebrew-language texts , the term lilith or lilit  (  translated as `` night creatures '' , `` night monster '' , `` night hag '' , or `` screech owl ''  )  first occurs in a list of animals in Isaiah 34:14 , either in singular or plural form according to variations in the earliest manuscripts .

When the ambitious yet evil scientist Anders Raeborne  (  David Hewlett  )  used an extract from Lilith 's blood in an attempt to become immortal , he became the evil Demonicus , a powerful monster who transmitted a red plague with his bite and tongue .
When Lilith and Naamah  (  another aspect of Lilith  )  were with Adam in his 130-year separation from Eve after the fall , they had daughters born from their union .
See Lilith  (  disambiguation  )  for a complete listing of characters named Lilith .
From these passages rabbi Isaac Luria believed that Lilith was to be restored to Adam through the marriage of Leah to Jacob -- Jacob was Adam , Leah was Lilith , and Rachel was Eve .
